Lobbyist Name: Irish Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Children
Specific Details: ISPCC's concerns about the possibility that, in December 2020, under the European Electronic Communications Code, tools currently being deployed to achieve the removal of child sexual abuse materials and to achieve other child protection objectives could become illegal.
DPOs Lobbied: Alan Dillon|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Maria Walsh|MEP|European Parliament::Clare Daly|MEP|European Parliament
Subject Matter: ISPCC's concerns about the possibility that, in December 2020, under the European Electronic Communications Code, tools currently being deployed to achieve the removal of child sexual abuse materials and to achieve other child protection objectives could become illegal.
Intended Results: That MEPs would champion this with colleagues in the LIBE committee of the European Parliament and that these tools would not become illegal.

Specific Details: Economic impacts to the business community, owners and employees, being endured during the Covid Restrictions.
DPOs Lobbied: Richard Bruton|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Alan Dillon|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: Economic impacts to the business community, owners and employees, being endured during the Covid Restrictions.
Intended Results: Focused discussion on two case studies of businesses, one in Tralee and one in County Kerry who have lost significant trade with the closure of other businesses under the restrictions, and specifically who are unable to avail of the CRSS supports for business, and the impact that is having. In our submissions to the meeting we also focused in on the impact on Town Centres over the past number of years and the need to address vacancy.::We also had the opportunity to present the need for increased support for County Kerry, including seeking inclusion for Kerry in the Western Development Commission. We also outlined the significant impact on the tourism and hospitality industry in Kerry, and made contributions on the opportunities for Remote Working in Kerry.
Lobbying Activities:
https://www.facebook.com/213649742081782/posts/3677503159029739/?d=n
dated 6th February 2021
CEO's of the Chambers Ireland network met online with 17 representatives of the Fine Gael parliamentary party led by Chair Richard Bruton TD and organised by Alan Dillon TD and Ian Talbot Chambers Ireland|Social Media|1
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Ken Tobin - CEO of Tralee Chambers Alliance

Lobbyist Name: ITOA - Inbound Tourism Operators Association Ireland
Specific Details: Meeting regarding Budgetary measures 2022 and ITOA submission to support the  ITOA members and tourism, focused on measures to supports its members survival after 2 years of practically no inbound tourism with asks being Grant-Aid Support for Inbound Operators due to loss of business in 2021 due to COVID travel restrictions, retention of 9% VAT rate beyond 2022 and increased international tourism marketing fund
DPOs Lobbied: Alan Dillon|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: Meeting regarding Budgetary measures 2022 and ITOA submission to support the  ITOA members and tourism, focused on measures to supports its members survival after 2 years of practically no inbound tourism with asks being Grant-Aid Support for Inbound Operators due to loss of business in 2021 due to COVID travel restrictions, retention of 9% VAT rate beyond 2022 and increased international tourism marketing fund
Intended Results: to support the survival of the inbound tourism sector and ITOA members given the impact of COVID 19 on inbound tourism

Specific Details: Regnum Renewables are trying to understand the different ways in which a favourable planning decision can be achieved for our potential wind farm sites, that are not currently supported by the renewable energy strategy in the relevant county development plan.
DPOs Lobbied: Alan Dillon|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Paul Hogan|Acting Assistant Secretary|Department of Housing, Local Government and Heritage::Graham Doyle|Secretary General|Department of Housing, Local Government and Heritage::Stephen Kinsella|Special Advisor|Department of the Taoiseach
Subject Matter: Regnum Renewables are trying to understand the different ways in which a favourable planning decision can be achieved for our potential wind farm sites, that are not currently supported by the renewable energy strategy in the relevant county development plan.
Intended Results: We hope to improve our chances of receiving a positive decision on future planning applications, on sites that do not currently have a favourable designation in the renewable energy strategy in their respective county development plans.
Lobbying Activities:
Ivan Yates, providing advisory services to Regnum, met with Alan Dillon TD in his office in Mayo on 12/07. 
They discussed the obstacles facing wind farm developers on both a national and local scale due to county development plans (CDP) in Ireland, potential avenues for initiating changes to county development plans, the benefits of large investment projects to rural areas and the likelihood of planning in contravention of CDP. Discussed a potential RRDL site in Srah and Bohaun, in South Mayo. |Meeting|1::Ivan Yates, providing advisory services to Regnum, met with Graham Doyle in the CHQ Building in Dublin on 17/06 to introduce himself and Regnum. 
Discussed all aspects of planning policy, both locally and nationally, in relation to development of renewable projects, with particular reference to onshore wind and specific challenges. 
Discussed the renewable targets in the upcoming NPF and the renewable strategies in 31 CDPs, electricity shortages without urgent deployment of energy projects. |Meeting|1::Ivan Yates, providing advisory services to Regnum, met with Paul Hogan in the Alex Hotel in Dublin on 25/07 to introduce himself and Regnum. 
Discussed all aspects of planning policy in relation to development of renewable projects, with a focus on onshore wind and the specific challenges. 
Frequency and reasons for judicial reviews were discussed, the renewable targets set out in the NPF and the renewable strategies in 31 CDPs, electricity shortages without urgent deployment of energy projects.|Meeting|1::Ivan Yates exchanged text messages with Stephen Kinsella, a recently appointed special advisor to the Taoiseach to arrange a meeting to discuss the role of energy and infrastructure development in the coming years. |Informal communication|2-5
Current or Former DPOs: Ivan Yates|Minister|Department of Agriculture, Food and the Marine
